result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Scott P Wolfe

records.addlTxt: Review hearing on October 25, 2022 at 09:00 am.

11:46 AM 
Clerk Micki.
INCLUDES 22CF209, 22CF211, and 22CF155

State appears by ADA Hannah Boeck; Defendant appears in person, with Attorney Francisco Araiza.

Date and time set for a Motion Hearing on 22CF211.  Other files tracking.

ADA Boeck recites history. This case is number 1 for JT on 9/14/22.

State's MIL - #1-#15 Defense does not object - COURT grants. 

Defense did not file MIL.

ADA Boeck makes statement regarding lab testing. Lab needs 30 days to test sample. Moves to adjourn the JT on 9/14/22.
Atty Araiza objects to the adjournment. Makes statements. 
ADA Boeck makes statement. Requesting an adjournment.

COURT grants State's request for an adjournment. 
COURT reschedules JT for 10/25-10/26/22 at 9:00 a.m.

NEXT DATE>>
JT - 10/25 and 10/26/22 at 9:00 a.m. 

ADJ: 12:02 p.m.

Clerk:  Kelly
Case Called:  2:54

**Includes 22CM155, 22CF211, 22CF209
Date & Time set for Judicial Pretrial/Tentative Plea.

State of Wisconsin appears by ADA Hannah Boeck; Defendant fails to appear.  Atty. Araiza appears via Zoom audio.
State requests Bench Warrant.
2:55 - Defendant now appears in person.
Atty. Araiza makes statement and requests JT in case 22CF211.

COURT sets Jury Trial September 14-15, 2022 at 9:00 in Branch 6.
Motion Hearing August 29, 2022 at 11:30 - Motions due by August 19, 2022.
22CM155 & 22CF2029 to track.

281 Grand Ave
Schofield, WI 54476

Clerk: Becca.

Adj: 1:30 pm.
Notice for Scott Wolfe of Review Hearing 3/2 @1:00pm, Preliminary Hearing 3/7 @9:10am, and Judicial pre-trial 4/18 @2:45pm (return to sender - insufficient address; unable to forward).
Review hearing on March 9, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Clerk: Mai 
Case Called: 1:26 pm 
INCLUDE CASES: 22CF209, 22CF211, 22CM155. 

Deft appears in person, pro se. 
Date and time set for review re: public defender representation prior to preliminary hearing. 
Court notes counsel has not yet been appointed.  
COURT finds good cause to extend time limits for preliminary hearing. 
Prelim set for 3/7/2022 to be removed from calendar. 
Review set for 3/9/2022 at 1:00 pm in Courtoom 101.
 
Adj: 1:30 pm

Review hearing on March 2, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary Hearing on March 7, 2022 at 09:10 am.
Judicial Pretrial - in court on April 18, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

INCLUDES 22CF209, 22CF211, 22CM155.       No contact with victim(s):  D.F. in 22CF211.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  Absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed.  No possession of drug paraphernalia.    Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level (1) supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.

Clerk: Nikki
Case Called: 2:32pm.
INCLUDES 22CF209, 22CF211, 22CM155, 05FA543 and 99PA27.
State appears by ADA Molly Lawrence. Defendant appears via Zoom, in custody, and with Atty Jack Mathie. Marathon County appears by Atty Shelley Wells.
VCRW.
Reading Waived. Reserve Jurisdiction.
Court questions defendant re: complaint and rights.
Prelim Time Limits Preserve.
PLEA: NOT GUILTY on 22CM155.

BOND:
$1000.00 signature bond applicable to all 3 cases.

CONDITIONS:
-No contact with victim(s): D.F. in 22CF211.
-Absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed.
-No possession of drug paraphernalia.
-Report to ATTIC Correctional Services within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 1 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.

DATES:
RH w/CC. 3/2 @1:00pm
PH w/CC: 3/7 @9:10am.
JPTC: 4/18 @2:45pm.

COURT QUASHES WARRANT in 05FA543 and 99PA27.
Atty Wells requests court to hold deft in contempt.
COURT defers request.

DATES:

Adjourned: 2:40pm.
